TopicTitle: Is there a use for something like this?

Articles.Content:
![9TlHXlv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9TlHXlv.jpg)

Two stage rocket. Each stage has a mix of engines. Total thrust for the two sides of each stage is the same i.e. it's balanced. So it flies to orbit fine. 

Any reason something like that might be useful?

> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/9TlHXlv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/9TlHXlv.jpg)
> Two stage rocket. Each stage has a mix of engines. Total thrust for the two sides of each stage is the same i.e. it's balanced. So it flies to orbit fine. 
> 
> Any reason something like that might be useful?

Yeah, if you want to use it in a KSP frankenvideo and scare little children... ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
actually, if you have a part test contract and an explore here contract but you are on a budget cut.
Well I imagine you could design it so different clusters have different ISP's and TWR's. Use the high TWR for emergency manuevers, and the high ISP ones for deltaV savings.

It's very artistic and a fine example of out of the box thinking!

No, I don't see any other use for it. Yet.

Since when did KSP demand a use for anything? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Correct flag again, btw ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> Since when did KSP demand a use for anything?

Excellent point well made. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Of course not! It doesn't have any nose cones on the exposed nodes! THAT'S what makes a rocket useful.

Seriously, it probably makes a pretty good VTOL.
